result.execSummary:
The defendant ROBERT N KURUC JR was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. ROBERT N KURUC JR is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • ROBERT N KURUC JR was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • ROBERT N KURUC JR was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:58 AM Defendant ROBERT N KURUC JR in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for ROBERT N KURUC JR. Court calls 2022CF6 & 2022CF11. Court recites agreement - defendant will plead to count 1 in 2022CF11 with probation; defendant will plead to count 1 in 2021CF6 with probation; defendant will plead to count 4 in 2022CF11 with jail, fine, costs, DL revocation, AODA and DNA sample. Statement by DA. Further statement by DA, concurs. Atty Kapelis concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged in 2021CF6 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 4 as charged in 2022CF11 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in and orders count 3 be dismissed outright. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2021CF6 (count 1) / 2022CF11 (Count 1) - EACH

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-AODA and any follow-up. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

2022CF11 (count 4)

-90 days county jail. Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel. 
-$500 fine plus costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Blood Draw Fee - $50.00
-DL revocation - 1 year
-AODA (Waushara)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 11:14
(Defendant's copy of NOH advising of 7/12/2022 pleas/sentencing hearing has been returned, marked no mail receptacle, unable to forward)
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:53 p.m.   DA Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Robert Kuruc, Jr. appeared by Zoom video.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for defendant.  Court questions defendant regarding Jr suffix of his name.  Defendant's name to be updated with Jr. on 21CF6.  Atty Kapelis states offer has been accepted.  Defendant concurs.  Court statement to defendant.  Court sets plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2022 at 10:30 a.m.  Mandatory appearances.
Court adjourned 2:54 p.m.

Letter to Judge Slate from Atty Michael Kapelis dated 06/20/2022 re: request for defendant to appear via zoom due to exposure to covid and request for plea & sentencing date      (NOTE: 06/20 approved)
(Defendant's copy of Scheduling Order filed 4/26/2022 has been returned with no forwarding address provided)
Scheduling Order

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant ROBERT N KURUC appeared by video.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for ROBERT N KURUC. Statement by Atty Kapelis, was just appointed on one of the cases. Court sets for Status Hearing on June 21, 2022 at 2:00 PM and all motions and witness lists to be filed the day before.
(Atty Michael Kapelis)
Status hearing on April 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

11:46 AM Defendant ROBERT N KURUC JR appeared by video.  Attorney Michael Kapelis appears in court. Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states the def would like to waive his right to a prelim. Def concurs. Def has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court and emailed it to Atty Kapelis - mirrors criminal complaint. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading . Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on all counts on behalf of the defendant. Court will set both cases for Status Hearing on April 26, 2022 at 1:15 PM. Mandatory Appearance

Court adjourned at 11:50 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Atty Kapelis informed us via email that the def no longer has transportation to Court due to the weather. Zoom information was given.

9:14 AM Defendant ROBERT N KURUC JR appeared in court, Attorney Michael Kapelis appeared in court for ROBERT N KURUC JR, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as repeater. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set 21CF6 for Status and 22CF11 for Status of Prelim for February 22 at 1:30 PM.  21CF6 to track.

Court adjourned at 9:18 AM.
